bug.short_desc: Impossible to change cell padding in a table

long_desc.thetext:
I have a table where I want to change the padding in all the cells of a column.
Initially I thought this would be possible via the cell renderer, by calling:
cellRenderer.setDefaultCellStyle("padding: 0px;");
The problem is that the padding will be set to 0px but the cell width computation will be false (note that I set a width manually on that column) and will still take into account a padding of 6px. This is because the width computation is done in _getCellSizeStyle, and takes into account this._insetX which will be set to 13 (6+6+1) at start. There's no way to change that _insetX, which does not play nice with a manually set padding.
A wrong width for the cell then subsequently ruins everything.
Please implement an (easy, if possible) way to change cell padding in tables.
